text: Trapezitsa (Bulgarian: Трапезица) is a medieval stronghold located on a hill with the same name in Veliko Tarnovo in northern Bulgaria. The hill Trapezitsa ==History== During the Second Bulgarian Empire the first castle of the Asen dynasty was built on the hill.http://visit.guide-bulgaria.com/ In the following years Boyars and Orthodox clerics lived on the hill. The Monastery of St Ivan Rilski (John of Rila) was located in this fortress. The relics of the Saint were kept there until 1495.http://www.alamy.com/s Trapezitsa Hill,Churches Ruins,Veliko Tarnovo ==Recovery== Since the 1970s the Bulgarian government has had plans for the restoration of the historical hill. In 2009 the south watchtower was restored. ==References== Category:Castles in Bulgaria Category:Buildings and structures in Veliko Tarnovo Category:Tourist attractions in Veliko Tarnovo Province Category:Veliko Tarnovo
